Let G = (gi,j) ∈ R n×n be the matrix obtained by arranging gi,j = d2 i,n+1 + d2 j,n+1 − d 2 i,j (1 ≤ i, j ≤ n) in the index order. Answer the following questions. (1) Let n = 2. For each of the following two cases, ﬁnd a tuple of three points p1, p2, p3 ∈ R2 satisfying the condition: (a) (d1,2, d1,3, d2,3) = (1, 1, 1); (b) (d1,2, d1,3, d2,3) = (1, 2, 3). (2) Deﬁne xj = pj − pn+1 (1 ≤ j ≤ n), and let X = (xj) ∈ R n×n be the matrix obtained by arranging xj in the index order. For each of the two answers in (1), calculate X ⊤X. (3) Prove that G is positive semideﬁnite in general, where an n × n real symmetric matrix A ∈ R n×n is said to be positive semideﬁnite if v⊤Av ≥ 0 for every vector v ∈ Rn. Let the vector ﬁeld F = xi + 2yj + 10zk. Find the integral of F over the following areas S1, S2 and S3. (1) S1 is the part of the cylindrical surface x 2 + z2 = 1 (0 ≤ y ≤ 4), i.e., the surface of the cylinder without top and bottom disks. Use the normal vector pointing outside the cylinder. (2) S2 is the surface consisting of the part of the cylindrical surface x 2 + z2 = 1 (0 ≤ y ≤ 4, 0 ≤ z) and the rectangular surface z = 0 (−1 ≤ x ≤ 1, 0 ≤ y ≤ 4), i.e., the surface of the half-cylinder without top and bottom planes. Use the normal vector pointing outside the half-cylinder. (3) S3 is the boundary of the region enclosed by the cylindrical surface x 2 + z2 = 1, the planes z = 0, y = 0 and x + y = 4.
